title: California Non-Disclosure Agreement
description: Standard mutual non-disclosure agreement for California business relationships. Protects confidential information shared between parties.

placeholders.name: disclosing_party
placeholders.label: Disclosing Party Name
placeholders.placeholder: Full legal name of the disclosing party

placeholders.name: receiving_party
placeholders.label: Receiving Party Name
placeholders.placeholder: Full legal name of the receiving party

placeholders.name: purpose
placeholders.label: Purpose of Disclosure
placeholders.placeholder: e.g., To evaluate potential business relationship

content.html:
MUTUAL NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT

This Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into as of {{effective_date}} (the "Effective Date") by and between:

Disclosing Party:
{{disclosing_party}}
{{disclosing_address}}

and

Receiving Party:
{{receiving_party}}
{{receiving_address}}

collectively referred to as the "Parties."

1. Purpose

The Parties agree to enter into this Agreement for the purpose of {{purpose}} (the "Purpose").

2. Definition of Confidential Information

"Confidential Information" shall mean any and all information disclosed by one Party to the other Party, whether orally or in writing, that is marked as confidential or that a reasonable person would understand to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure.

3. Obligations

Each Party agrees to: (a) hold the Confidential Information in strict confidence; (b) use the Confidential Information solely for the Purpose; (c) not disclose the Confidential Information to any third party without prior written consent; and (d) take all reasonable precautions to protect the Confidential Information.

4. Term

This Agreement shall remain in effect for a period of {{term_years}} year(s) from the Effective Date.

5. Return of Information

Upon termination of this Agreement, each Party shall promptly return or destroy all materials containing the other Party's Confidential Information.

6. Governing Law

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California.

Disclosing Party
Receiving Party
Date

sample_data.purpose: To evaluate potential business relationship and investment opportunities
